step1.sentence: She managed to talk her brother into lending her his car for the weekend.

step2.story: Kevin was hesitant about joining the marathon, but his coworker wouldn't give up. After a week of encouragement, she finally talked him into signing up. Now he trains every morning before work.

step3.story: Mia had been saving for months to go on a solo trip to Japan, but her best friend Jess wanted to come along. At first, Mia politely declined — she needed this time alone to recharge. But Jess kept bringing up all the fun they'd have exploring Tokyo together. She talked Mia into splitting an Airbnb to save money, which actually made the budget work better. By the time they landed in Narita, Mia was glad she'd been talked into sharing the adventure. Sometimes the best trips are the ones you didn't plan alone.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '말로 ~안으로 들어가게 하다'라는 뜻으로, 대화를 통해 상대방을 어떤 행동 쪽으로 이끈다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 누군가를 설득해서 원래 하지 않으려던 일을 하게 만들 때 사용합니다. 'talk someone into doing something' 형태로 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'talk'(말하다)와 'into'(~안으로)의 결합으로, 말을 통해 상대를 특정 행동이나 결정 안으로 끌어들인다는 비유에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 강압적이기보다는 끈기 있게 설득하는 느낌입니다. 반대 표현인 'talk out of'(~하지 않도록 설득하다)와 함께 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I talked my parents into getting a puppy.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 나는 부모님을 설득해서 강아지를 키우게 했다.
